title: Obituary: Ratan Tata, the 'modest' Indian tycoon
content: The businessman led a conglomerate of more than 100 companies, employing some 660,000 people.

title: India's Ratan Tata: in his own words
content: The legendary business tycoon has died at the age of 86.

title: Indian tycoon Ratan Tata dies aged 86
content: His death was announced by the Tata Group, the multi-billion-dollar conglomerate he led for more than two decades.

title: Rekha at 70: Bollywood's timeless icon
content: Rekha has captured headlines and people's imaginations for decades while blazing a trail for others.

title: Ruthless India knock Sri Lanka out of contention
content: India boost their semi-final hopes with an 82-run thrashing of Sri Lanka at the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: 'Our son died. Now we can use his sperm to have a grandchild'
content: An Indian court has cleared the way for a couple to use their dead son's frozen sperm.

title: Kashmir and Haryana prove India exit polls wrong
content: India's ruling BJP appears on course to hold Haryana state but is heading for defeat in Kashmir.

title: Teen breaks record by climbing Earth's highest peaks
content: The 18-year-old has become the youngest person to summit all 14 of the world's 8,000m peaks.

title: Indian financial aid opens 'new chapter' with Maldives
content: The deal comes as the Maldives president visits Delhi after relations nosedived in recent months.

title: Climbers rescued after three days in the Himalayas
content: A British climber who went missing in the Himalayas has spoken of her relief after surviving for two days in "brutal" conditions that put her life in danger.

title: The Polish artist who painted Hindu gods in Indian palaces
content: Stefan Norblin painted beautiful murals in the art deco style for Indian maharajas in the 1940s.

title: How India became a Test cricket powerhouse
content: More than 90 years after its first Test match, India boasts more victories in the format than losses.

title: India's iconic tramcars set to ride into Kolkata sunset
content: Kolkata's iconic trams are in danger of being shut down entirely. But activists are fighting back.

title: My mission is to take Tamil music global, says Sid Sriram
content: The Indian-born, American-raised artist is going to perform his biggest solo UK show.

title: India's top court saves a poor student's college dream
content: Atul Kumar missed the deadline to pay his college fee by a few seconds - then a court stepped in to help him.

title: The 'mastermind' behind India's biggest jailbreak
content: Nearly 20 years ago, 389 men escaped from an Indian jail, led by a man believed to have planned the breakout.

title: The world’s diamond polishing capital feels Ukraine war impact
content: Wars and recession in key Western markets have left India's diamond industry workers distraught and jobless.

title: Sold out in minutes, resold for millions: Coldplay tickets spark outrage in India
content: Coldplay's concerts in Mumbai sold out in minutes and now resellers are charging up to $10,000 for a ticket.

title: A famed holy sweet in an unsavoury row in India
content: The famous Tirupati temple laddus are prized by devotees who consider them god’s blessing.

title: Your essential guide to the ICC Women's T20 World Cup
content: The Women's T20 World Cup in the United Arab Emirates starts on 3 October - here's everything you need to know about the ninth edition.

title: The Kashmiri politician whose return from jail ruffled feathers
content: A court has allowed jailed lawmaker Engineer Rashid to return to Kashmir to campaign in regional polls.

title: Death of Indian employee sparks debate on 'toxic work culture'
content: Anna Perayil's parents allege she died four months after starting a job because of "overwhelming work stress".

title: Tigers and crocs make mangrove preservation tough work
content: To help preserve mangrove forests researchers have to take on demanding field work.

title: How Punjabi megastar Diljit Dosanjh is inspiring the next gen
content: The biggest Punjabi singer in the world brings his Dil-Luminati tour to the UK.

title: Hema committee report: Why are India's biggest film stars silent?
content: The stars’ silence on a report exposing poor working conditions and sexual harassment in Kerala’s film industry is deafening, say critics.

title: Volunteers dying as Russia’s war dead tops 70,000
content: The governments of India and Nepal have called on Moscow to stop sending their citizens to Ukraine and repatriate the bodies of the dead.

title: Why hundreds of Samsung workers are protesting in India
content: About 1500 workers in Tamil Nadu state have been striking work for the past 11 days.

title: India's oldest trams may soon be brought to a halt
content: Authorities in the eastern city of Kolkata announced plans to discontinue its iconic trams first set up in 1873.

title: Kolkata night protest: 'Today I witnessed history'
content: A young woman was among thousands who took part in a march in India's West Bengal. This is what she saw.

title: Watch: Thousands of women protest about rape and murder of doctor in India
content: Women led a march in West Bengal state after a female doctor's brutal rape and murder last week.

title: Watch: Building collapses into river in Himachal Pradesh
content: No-one was injured in the incident, which took place due to heavy rainfall.

title: Watch: Blue screens, queues and airport delays worldwide
content: Many flights have been grounded, with huge queues and delays at airports all over the world.

title: WATCH: Families mourn victims of deadly India crush
content: At least 121 people, mostly women, were killed in the crush at a religious event in northern India.

title: Watch: Delhi airport roof collapses due to heavy rain
content: The incident has left one person dead and injured four others.

title: What worked for India's Modi - and what didn’t?
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his party have won the most seats in this year's election.
